vulnerability.message: When setting signal handlers, do not use the same function to handle multiple signals. There exists the possibility a race condition will result if 2 or more different signals are sent to the process at nearly the same time. Also, when writing signal handlers, it is best to do as little as possible in them. The best strategy is to use the signal handler to set a flag, that another part of the program tests and performs the appropriate action(s) when it is set. foSee also: http://razor.bindview.com/publish/papers/signals.txt

vulnerability.message: Thame argument of open should be carefully checked if it is being created with any user-supplied string as a compontent of it.
